Select Columns with Significant Concentration or Non-Uniformity

Source: R/method.R
iskept.Rd

This function identifies columns in a probability matrix that are either: (1) statistically significant using a column-wise p-value aggregation method (e.g., Simes), or (2) deviate most from uniformity if none are significant.

Usage

iskept(pval, alpha = 0.05)

Arguments

pval

A numeric matrix of p-values (dimension: p × L), where each column corresponds to a single effect.

alpha

Significance threshold for p-value aggregation (default = 0.05).

Value

A logical vector of length L indicating selected columns:

  • TRUE if a column is retained (i.e., passes threshold or selected as fallback)

  • FALSE otherwise

Column names are preserved if available. At least one column will always be selected.

Details

Columns are assessed using a p-value combination method (e.g., combine_simes). If no column has an aggregated p-value below alpha, the fallback is to select the column that is most non-uniform (farthest from the uniform distribution).

Note

Assumes each column in pval contains valid p-values. Uses combine_simes() to aggregate p-values per column.
